component.text: Describe the purpose of Access Control Lists and port filtering
Deny All Traffic Destined for Network B
Click each security method for more information on port filtering and Access Control Lists.

A port filter can be implemented to prevent access to all other ports except web port 80. If a user tries to connect to the server using any other port, such as Telnet on TCP port 23, the user is denied access. This protects the server from being compromised.

Using an access control list, all computers on Network A are denied access from all computers on Network B. Network A is specified as the source network and Network B as the destination network. Traffic is denied if it meets those conditions. This still allows the computers on Network A to talk to the server on Network C.
